channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Gateways Shuttle Service to be Available for Holiday/Winter Break
item.description: Rensselaer’s Department of Parking and Transportation is pleased to announce that it will once again be offering Gateways shuttle transportation to and from regional destination points - including the Amtrak train station, the Albany International Airport, and the Albany bus terminal - for the upcoming holiday/winter break. Be sure to submit your transportation request by Tuesday, December 17!
item.author: Students

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Charles Curtis to Play Within | Without Limit: Music for Cello
item.description: Date: Saturday, December 14, 2024 2:00 PM - Internationally acclaimed Charles Curtis performs a Saturday matinee solo program that takes full advantage of the generous acoustic properties of the EMPAC Concert Hall! The program includes works by Carolyn Chen, Éliane Radigue, Guillaume de Machaut (14th c.), and Curtis’s own “Unfinished Song” (1998).
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Session to Highlight Single Course Enrollment Options
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 18, 2024 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., as he reviews the online graduate programs for working professionals and provides course enrollment options to make an immediate impact on one’s work. Participants can also explore courses for developing valuable skills that benefit employee and employer alike.
item.author: Community

item.title: Morning Mail Service to be Suspended During Holiday/Winter Break
item.description: DotCIO’s Web Services team asks the campus community to note that the daily Morning Mail service will be on temporary hiatus from Monday, December 23, 2024 through Wednesday, January 1, 2025, while the Institute is closed for its annual holiday/winter break.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 United Way Pledge Campaign Now Open
item.description: Date: Friday, October 18, 2024 12:00 AM - Mon , December 16, 2024 12:00 AM - The United Way of the Greater Capital Region works to advance the common good by focusing on basic needs, family support and financial stability, and Rensselaer has long been an active and proud partner in helping to create long-lasting systemic change toward a better tomorrow. Once again, Rensselaer’s United Way volunteers call upon the generosity of the campus community to help address societal challenges.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Open House-Farewell to Helen Grzymala, Welcome to Ann Marie Scheidegger to be Held December 16
item.description: Date: Monday, December 16, 2024 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Attend this event to help wish Helen Grzymala a “final” farewell on her retirement, and also to welcome Ann Marie Scheidegger as she takes over the reigns from Helen as our new Assistant Vice President for Budget and Resource Planning! Refreshments will be served.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: DotCIO Schedules Server Upgrades for December 21, 22
item.description:
DotCIO will be performing necessary server upgrades over the winter break. On Saturday 12/21 midnight through 11:59pm: IACSDept.win.rpi.edu. This will affect S drive for campus and V drive for departments. Sunday 12/22 9am to 1pm ET: IACSHome.win.rpi.edu. This will affect all U drives (home directories). In the event anything affects this schedule, we will update announcement on https://dotcio.rpi.edu

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
